intro: Dianthera lithospermifolia, commonly known as the stone root or rock rose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its roots are thick and fleshy, storing water for survival in harsh conditions. Dianthera lithospermifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
